intro: Lasiorrhiza cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. Lasiorrhiza cinerea prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
